title: Haluntium honours the son of Timandros
support: Quadrangular statue block, cut down across the top and with some damage to the left and right sides.

layout.p: Three lines of ancient Greek. The first line is partially lost across the top, the second and third are damaged at the left and right margins.

handNote.lettering: The letters are wide, well spaced and regular in form, and deeply incised. Alpha with straight bar; epsilon has short middle bar; kappa has full length arms; mu has vertical first and last, with middle strokes almost full height; omicron is full size; rho has large rounded head, closed; sigma has parallel top and bottom, and middle strokes almost full width; omega is closed, and slightly tear-drop shaped, with horizontal tails.

provenanceFound._: Original discovery not recorded, first published by Salinas in 1880.

museum.name: Museo Archeologico Regionale Antonino Salinas
museum.description: Partially reopened following extensive restoration work. Comprehensive collection of archaeological material, predominantly from the West of the island, with an important Etruscan collection.

location.address: Centre of Palermo, Piazza Olivella 24, 90100 - Palermo
